author: M K Madhusoodan
title: Cricket betting: CID summon ex-Hubballi-Dharwad DCP
text:
BANGALORE: The criminal investigation department (CID) has summoned former deputy commissioner of Hubballi-Dharwad in connection with the cricket betting racket and to question about the his alleged involvement in the racket prevailed in the twin city.
The former DCP Hanumantharaya was caught on camera early in June this year during a sting operation by a private Kannada TV channel and he was suspended later. The sting operation exposed the existence of a Rs 100 crore cricket betting racket in the north Karnataka city.
The CID officers, who interrogated him said that the former DCP repeatedly denied his involvement in the cricket betting racket and added that he was casually talking to one of the bookies and not placed any demand for money while conversing. "The former DCP was doubly careful to reveal anything under the guise of a departmental enquiry pending against him instituted to investigate allegations against him. He said he was talking to some of the batting racket members whom he had arrested earlier," said a CID officer.
The CID officers felt that the officer was careful during the day-long interrogation at the CID headquarters here, as he repeatedly denied any connection with the betting racket. Along with the former DCP two more constables were suspended after the sting operation which clearly showed the police personnel demanding money from the members of the racket, CID officers said.
The CID officers said that it may once again summon former Hubballi-Dharwad police commissioner Ravindra Prasad, now retired from service. He was earlier summoned by CID nearly a week ago.
